name: Pain Ordinaire
recipeIngredient: 15 g of fresh yeast or 2 tsp dried yeast,
recipeInstructions: 1. Pour 100 ml of water in a large bowl, sprinkle in the yeast, whisk lightly, and leave for 5 minutes.
2. Add a third of the flour and mix to a light paste. Cover the bowl with a tea towel and wait for 20 minutes.
3. Add the rest of the flour and salt and the majority of the remaining water. Mix, and add enough water to make a moist yet firm dough.
4. Knead for 10 minutes on a floured surface.
5. Leave covered to prove for 30 minutes to 2 hours, until more than doubled in size.
6. Knock back the dough for 1 minute and put in a greased bread tin.
7. Cover with a tea towel and leave for 45 minutes to 1 hour until doubles in size.
8. Place in a pre-heated oven at 220C/gas 7 for 45 minutes.
